TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Style

Docs.summary: Represents a style description for a range.

remarks.para: The Style object contains all style attributes (font, number format, alignment, and so on) as properties. There are several built-in styles, including Normal, Currency, and Percent. Using the Style object is a fast and efficient way to change several cell-formatting properties on multiple cells at the same time.
For the object, the Style object is a member of the collection. The Styles collection contains all the defined styles for the workbook.
Use the property to return the Style object used with a object.

You can change the appearance of a cell by changing properties of the style applied to that cell. Keep in mind, however, that changing a style property will affect all cells already formatted with that style.
Use Styles(), where is the style index number or name, to return a single Style object from the workbook Styles collection.

Styles are sorted alphabetically by style name. The style index number denotes the position of the specified style in the sorted list of style names. Styles(1) is the first style in the alphabetic list, and Styles(Styles.Count) is the last one in the list.
For more information about creating and modifying a style, see the object.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property _Default As String
public: property System::String ^ default { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AddIndent { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if text is automatically indented when the text alignment in a cell is set to equal distribution either horizontally or vertically.

remarks.para: To set text alignment to equal distribution, you can set the property to xlVAlignDistributed when the value of the property is xlVertical, and you can set the property to xlHAlignDistributed when the value of the Orientation property is xlHorizontal.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the Microsoft Excel application.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Borders As Borders

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents the borders of a style.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BuiltIn As Boolean
public: property bool BuiltIn { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: True if the style is a built-in style.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As XlCreator

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which this object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns the string XCEL, which is equivalent to the hexadecimal number 5843454C.
The Creator property is designed to be used in Microsoft Excel for the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Excel has the creator code XCEL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Delete() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Deletes the object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Font As Font
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Font ^ Font { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Font ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the font of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool FormulaHidden { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the formula will be hidden when the worksheet is protected.

remarks.para: Don’t confuse this property with the property. The formula will not be hidden if the workbook is protected and the worksheet is not, but only if the worksheet is protected.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlHAlign HorizontalAlignment { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlHAlign get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlHAlign value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the horizontal alignment for the specified object.

remarks.para: can be one of the following XlHAlign constants:
Some of these constants may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you've selected or installed.

Docs.summary: True if the style includes the , , , and border properties.

Docs.summary: True if the style includes the , , , , , , , , , , , , , and font properties.

Docs.summary: True if the style includes the and properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int IndentLevel { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the indent level for the style.

remarks.para: Using this property to set the indent level to a number less than 0 (zero) or greater than 15 causes an error.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Interior As Interior

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the interior of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Locked { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the object is locked; False if the object can be modified when the sheet is protected.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ MergeCells { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: True if the style contains merged cells.

remarks.para: When you select a range that contains merged cells, the resulting selection may be different from the intended selection. Use the property to check the address of the selected range.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Name As String
public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the name of the object.

remarks.para: The following table shows example values of the Name property and related properties given an data source with the unique name "[Europe].[France].[Paris]" and a non-OLAP data source with the item name "Paris".
When specifying an index into the collection, you can use the syntax shown in the following table.
When using the property to reference a specific member of a collection, you can use the text index name as shown in the following table.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property NameLocal As String
public: property System::String ^ NameLocal { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the name of the object in the language of the user.

remarks.para: If the style is a built-in style, this property returns the name of the style in the language of the current locale.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ NumberFormat { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the format code for the object.

remarks.para: The format code is the same string as the Format Codes option in the Format Cells dialog box. The Format function uses different format code strings than do the NumberFormat and properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ NumberFormatLocal { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the format code for the object as a string in the language of the user.

remarks.para: The Format function uses different format code strings than do the and NumberFormatLocal properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlOrientation Orientation { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlOrientation get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlOrientation value); };

Docs.summary: The text orientation. Can be an integer value from –90 to 90 degrees or one of the constants.

remarks.para: XlOrientation can be one of the following constants:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent object for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ReadingOrder { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the reading order for the specified object.

remarks.para: The ReadingOrder property can be one of the following constants: xlRTL (right-to-left), xlLTR (left-to-right), or xlContext.
Some of these constants may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you've selected or installed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShrinkToFit { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if text automatically shrinks to fit in the available column width.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Value As String
public: property System::String ^ Value { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: The name of the specified style.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the vertical alignment of the specified object.

remarks.para: can be one of the following XlVAlign constants:
Some of these constants may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you've selected or installed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool WrapText { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Excel wraps the text in the object.
